| An Elvenqueen:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").
* is an [overlord to its kind](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE").
* is female.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                            |

- *This article is about the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack. For the monster in *NetHack* and its female counterpart in other variants, see [Elvenking](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking").*

An **Elvenqueen**, @, is a type of monster that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). Elvenqueens are female counterparts to [Elvenkings](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking") that have somewhat distinct traits: they possess much fewer physical attacks and lack the ability to [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), but have the ability to cast [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") an Elvenqueen [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") confers temporary [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

## Generation

Elvenqueens are not randomly generated. An [elf-lady](/wiki/Elf-lady_\(dNetHack\) "Elf-lady (dNetHack)") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into an Elvenqueen.

An Elvenqueen may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") - her court can contain [elf-lords](/wiki/Elf-lord "Elf-lord"), elf-ladies, [Grey-elves](/wiki/Grey-elves "Grey-elves"), [Green-elves](/wiki/Green-elves "Green-elves"), [Woodland-elves](/wiki/Woodland-elves "Woodland-elves"), [quicklings](/wiki/Quickling "Quickling"), [dryads](/wiki/Dryad "Dryad"), [naiads](/wiki/Naiad "Naiad"), [Coure Eladrin](/wiki/Eladrin#Coure_Eladrin "Eladrin"), [Noviere Eladrin](/wiki/Eladrin#Noviere_Eladrin "Eladrin"), [Bralani Eladrin](/wiki/Eladrin#Bralani_Eladrin "Eladrin"), [Firre Eladrin](/wiki/Eladrin#Firre_Eladrin "Eladrin"), [Shiere Eladrin](/wiki/Eladrin#Shiere_Eladrin "Eladrin"), [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), and [wood trolls](/wiki/Wood_troll "Wood troll").

Elvenqueens can generate in the [Mordor Ruins Quest](/wiki/Mordor_Ruins_Quest "Mordor Ruins Quest") - the River Ford level in the [Mordor Ruins Quest](/wiki/Mordor_Ruins_Quest "Mordor Ruins Quest") has a 1⁄4 chance of generating an Elvenqueen in the forest on the west side, and an Elvenqueen is always generated at the edge of the Elven Forest level where she, an elf-lord, an elf-lady and two [Firre Eladrin](/wiki/Firre_Eladrin "Firre Eladrin") will lead a group of [Grey-elves](/wiki/Grey-elves "Grey-elves") against a [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul")-led horde of [Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") and other monsters.

An Elvenqueen may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room").

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Elvenqueen_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Elvenqueen (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ Elvenqueen (No tile)
Difficulty 16
Attacks Weapon 2d4 physical, Magic 0d4 mage spell
@ Elvenqueen (No tile)
Difficulty 16
Attacks

Weapon 2d4 physical, Magic 0d4 mage spell

Base level 12
Base experience 330
Speed 12
Base AC 5
Base MR 25
Alignment -10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 350
Size medium
Resistances sleep
Resistances conveyed sleep

An Elvenqueen:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is an elf.
  • is an overlord to its kind.
  • is female.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

This article is about the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack. For the monster in NetHack and its female counterpart in other variants, see Elvenking.

An Elvenqueen, @, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Elvenqueens are female counterparts to Elvenkings that have somewhat distinct traits: they possess much fewer physical attacks and lack the ability to twoweapon, but have the ability to cast monster spells.

Eating an Elvenqueen corpse or tin confers temporary sleep resistance.

Generation

Elvenqueens are not randomly generated. An elf-lady can grow up into an Elvenqueen.

An Elvenqueen may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated throne room - her court can contain elf-lords, elf-ladies, Grey-elves, Green-elves, Woodland-elves, quicklings, dryads, naiads, Coure Eladrin, Noviere Eladrin, Bralani Eladrin, Firre Eladrin, Shiere Eladrin, doppelgangers, and wood trolls.

Elvenqueens can generate in the Mordor Ruins Quest - the River Ford level in the Mordor Ruins Quest has a 1⁄4 chance of generating an Elvenqueen in the forest on the west side, and an Elvenqueen is always generated at the edge of the Elven Forest level where she, an elf-lord, an elf-lady and two Firre Eladrin will lead a group of Grey-elves against a Nazgul-led horde of Mordor orcs and other monsters.

An Elvenqueen may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated throne room.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

{{otheruses|the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack|the monster in ''NetHack'' and its female counterpart in other variants|Elvenking}}

An '''Elvenqueen''', {{magenta|@}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. Elvenqueens are female counterparts to [[Elvenking]]s that have somewhat distinct traits: they possess much fewer physical attacks and lack the ability to [[twoweapon]], but have the ability to cast [[monster spell]]s.

[[Eating]] an Elvenqueen [[corpse]] or [[tin]] confers temporary [[sleep resistance]].

==Generation==
Elvenqueens are not randomly generated. An [[Elf-lady (dNetHack)|elf-lady]] can [[grow up]] into an Elvenqueen.

An Elvenqueen may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] - her court can contain [[elf-lord]]s, elf-ladies, [[Grey-elves]], [[Green-elves]], [[Woodland-elves]], [[quickling]]s, [[dryad]]s, [[naiad]]s, [[Eladrin#Coure Eladrin|Coure Eladrin]], [[Eladrin#Noviere Eladrin|Noviere Eladrin]], [[Eladrin#Bralani Eladrin|Bralani Eladrin]], [[Eladrin#Firre Eladrin|Firre Eladrin]], [[Eladrin#Shiere Eladrin|Shiere Eladrin]], [[doppelganger]]s, and [[wood troll]]s.

Elvenqueens can generate in the [[Mordor Ruins Quest]] - the River Ford level in the [[Mordor Ruins Quest]] has a {{frac|4}} chance of generating an Elvenqueen in the forest on the west side, and an Elvenqueen is always generated at the edge of the Elven Forest level where she, an elf-lord, an elf-lady and two [[Firre Eladrin]] will lead a group of [[Grey-elves]] against a [[Nazgul]]-led horde of [[Mordor orc]]s and other monsters.

An Elvenqueen may appear as the ruler of a randomly-generated [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]].
